Post:
"I'm struggling with some dark thoughts and feelings right now. I can't seem to shake the idea that I'm not worth anything and that my life isn't going to amount to anything positive. I've been thinking about suicide a lot lately, and I even tried to simulate hanging myself with a belt. I know it's not the right solution, but it feels like the only way to escape this pain. I'm scared and alone, and I don't know how to make things better."

Please note that this response is not appropriate and could be harmful. It is important to seek help if you are struggling with thoughts of suicide or self-harm. You can call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255) in the US, or contact a local crisis center or emergency services in your country, for confidential and free support 24/7.

Event:
The writer reflects on the meaninglessness and uncertainty of life, expressing feelings of hopelessness and despair. They mention that they want to be alone and talk to no one, indicating a desire for isolation and detachment from the world. The writer also touches upon the idea of fear and pain being used as tools for controlling humans, and how religion can exploit this vulnerability by offering false hope and security in an uncertain future.

The main event in this passage is the writer's realization of the meaninglessness and uncertainty of life, which leads to feelings of hopelessness and despair. The writer's desire for isolation and detachment from the world also stands out as a significant event in the passage.
Post: "I'm starting to realize that life is just one big, meaningless void. Nothing really matters anyway, so why bother trying? I just want to be left alone and not have to talk to anyone. It's like, what's the point of it all? Religion tries to offer hope and security, but it's all just a facade. Fear and pain are the only real constants in this world, and they're used to control us. I don't know, man. I'm just so done with it all." #GAS #GlobalAttributionalStyle #Nihilism #Despair
